󰲡 Excel Training Program & Digital Workflow Prototype

 󰲣 Executive Summary

This project aims to develop a prototype for digitizing our company's data
and workflows, beginning with Excel training and centralized data management.
The objective is to increase productivity and enhance problem-solving
capabilities across teams—particularly architects and related departments—
who regularly use Excel but often lack structured tools or sufficient
knowledge to utilize it effectively in their daily operations.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

  󰲥 Project Objectives

• Develop a prototype system using Excel to support internal data handling.
• Build a training program focused on improving workflow through better
  Excel use.
• Identify inefficiencies and bottlenecks, especially in areas like
  requirement comparisons and area size projections.
• Deliver targeted Excel training to architecture and supporting departments.
• Measure improvements in workflow and data accuracy following training and
  tool implementation.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

  󰲥 Project Scope

This project focuses on the design and delivery of a structured Excel
training program tailored for architects and related departments. The scope
includes:

• Curriculum Development:
  Create a training syllabus covering key Excel concepts ranging from data
  cleaning and logic functions to pivot tables and basic dashboards.

• Use-Case Alignment:
  Integrate real-world scenarios into the curriculum (e.g., requirement
  comparison, area projections, cost tracking) to ensure training relevance.

• Workshop Delivery:
  Conduct hands-on training sessions (live or self-paced) designed to improve
  everyday efficiency and task accuracy.

• *Workflow Assessment:
  Identify recurring workflow issues Excel can address, and prototype
  spreadsheet tools or templates to solve them.

• Exclusions:
  This scope does not cover database implementation or external system
  integration at this stage.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

 󰲣 Deliverables

• Excel Training Curriculum: A structured syllabus with learning outcomes,
  modules, and exercises.
• Use-Case Worksheets: Functional Excel tools that directly implement
  relevant workflow use cases, such as requirement comparison and area
  projection calculators. These tools are intended for daily use, not just
  practice.
  • Note: While only requirement comparison and area projection calculators
    will be developed in this project, successful adoption may lead to future
    expansions such as cost tracking sheets or submission log trackers.
• Workshop Materials: Slide decks, live demo files, and step-by-step
  guides.
• Workflow Issue Report: Document summarizing recurring inefficiencies
  identified during the training.
 Evaluation & Feedback Summary: Compilation of participant feedback and
  training effectiveness metrics.

---

## Applications

 Less reliance on manual file checking and visual comparisons
 Reusable templates for budgeting, comparison, and reporting
 Cross-team data sharing through structured Excel tools

---

## Implementation Plan

Phase 1: Training rollout (week 1–3)
Phase 2: Collect feedback, measure impact, refine prototype (week 4–6)

---

## Conclusion & Discussion

This project lays the groundwork for larger-scale digital transformation.

By equipping team members with Excel skills and simple prototypes, we can
establish a data-driven foundation that can be expanded with future tools
(e.g., databases, dashboards, automation).

Further evaluation will determine whether to migrate from Excel to more
robust systems (e.g., web-based apps or integrated databases) once workflows
are mapped and improved.
